article_title: A Move to Unite Tea Party, Social Conservatives
article_text:
At a conference of religious conservatives, Texas Sen. Ted Cruz rehearsed a theme that is becoming a sweet spot for potential Republican presidential candidates: defending religious liberty.

On Thursday at the Faith and Freedom Coalition, Mr. Cruz condemned the persecution of Christians in the Middle East and accused the U.S. government of infringing on religious liberties through the Affordable Care Act and the Internal Revenue...

twitter.description: Defending religious liberty is becoming a sweet spot for potential Republican presidential candidates as two of the GOP's most powerful factions, social conservatives and libertarian tea-party activists, are increasingly at odds over the party's priorities and tactics.
twitter.title: A Move to Unite Tea Party, Social Conservatives

image.alt: Defending religious liberty is becoming a sweet spot for potential Republican presidential candidates.
